meanings.definition: The unlawful premeditated killing of one human being by another.
meanings.sent1: The murder of the poor man shocked the entire town.
meanings.sent2: The detective solved the murder case after months of investigation.
meanings.sent3: The murder of the cake was a result of the clumsy baker's mistake.
meanings.sent4: The weeds in the garden committed murder on the beautiful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The horror movie depicted a gruesome murder scene that left viewers terrified.

meanings.definition: To kill (someone) unlawfully and with premeditation.
meanings.sent1: The criminal planned to murder his rival in cold blood.
meanings.sent2: The assassin was hired to murder the politician before the election.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally murdered the recipe by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to murder the sunlight, casting a dark shadow.
meanings.sent5: The evil queen ordered her guards to murder anyone who opposed her rule.

meanings.sent1: The rain threatened to murder our picnic plans.
meanings.sent2: Leaving the milk out in the sun will murder its freshness.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy painter managed to murder the beautiful mural with a single brushstroke.
meanings.sent4: The loud music seemed to murder the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent5: The harsh criticism felt like a verbal murder of the author's work.
